borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<div><span style="font-size:11pt">The proposed development, by reason of scale, siting, design, bulk, mass and appearance would be an <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="undesireable" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="m4h0p4n52b1644lt3">undesirable</span> addition,&nbsp;representing an overly dominant and disproportionate extension to the dwelling. The side extension would sit uncomfortably to the side of the host dwelling, significantly impacting the symmetry of the semi-detached dwelling, and failing to appear as subordinate. The side extension would be significantly visible from public vantage points and would be visually intrusive, represent poor design and would be out of character in the context of the area. As such, the proposal would cause undue harm to the character and appearance of the host dwelling and surrounding area, including to the historic distinctiveness of the Becontree Estate. The proposal is therefore contrary to the following policies which seek to ensure that development recognises local character and promotes good design whilst protecting and enhancing historic environments:</span></div><div><br></div><div><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
National Planning Policy Framework </span>National Planning Policy Framework
(NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy D4 of the
London Plan (March 2021)</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- The Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal">









</p><p><b><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- </span></b><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD5 of </span>The London Borough of
Barking and Dagenham’s Local Plan: (September 2024)<o:p></o:p></p></div>

<div>The proposed development, by reason of its scale, siting and design would cause severe harm to the neighbouring occupiers. Specifically, the proposed development would unacceptably result in a material loss of outlook, privacy, access to daylight and result in severe overshadowing whilst introducing a significant level of overbearing to the occupiers of no. 92 Rogers Road.&nbsp;It would therefore constitute unneighbourly development and is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
National Planning Policy Framework </span>National Planning Policy Framework
(NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy
D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></p><p><o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- The Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal">









</p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD5 of </span>The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Local Plan: (September 2024)<o:p></o:p></p></div>
description: Construction of a two storey side extension
